text: for now we don’t support data fetching in a way that suspense would help with - currently the fetch is done before we start rendering react either when including a graphql query as part of a module or when passing data in from hubl
can I use the ES5 module version of the `@HubSpot/api-client` in a React component? Does it force authentication even if I am using the public search API?
or even more to the point, is there a way to keep the access_token secret in that way (if it's necessary)? I'm trying to avoid using a serverless function because it might be slowing things down

It's a good ask, and something that is on our roadmap ... i.e. the ability to have secrets either for build time, or even server render time usage. However, it's not something currently we have a good solution for.

:this: additionally across the board we don’t support data fetching within components besides client-side fetches in an island, which definitely would not include access_token-using API calls. serverless functions are the best (and probably only?) way to do that right now
<@U04DVL5T2TE> do you happen to know if using the HubSpot api-client is a net benefit in terms of speed or should I do a "raw" query instead?
it wouldn’t be a benefit since it’s just adding layers, but i think it’s a pretty thin layer so i wouldn’t expect it to make much difference either way
my guess would be if it ends up being the main bottleneck your call would be really, really, really fast
alright, thanks again, I appreciate the insight
Is it possible for someone at HubSpot to update CORS headers to allow for the proxy version of a site to load endpoints?
